alert.note: Alert for Berks; Western Chester; Western Montgomery (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 21 at 3:11PM EST by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Berks, northwestern Montgomery and northeastern Chester Counties through 400 PM EST... At 311 PM EST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Richland, or near Myerstown, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Reading, Pottstown, Wyomissing, Birdsboro, Royersford, Fleetwood, Sinking Spring, Laureldale, East Greenville, Womelsdorf, Wernersville, Robesonia, Leesport, Bally, Bernville, Bechtelsville, Spring Ridge, Fairview Hgts, Geryville and Gilbertsville. This includes the following highways... Interstate 78 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 12 and 17. Interstate 176 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 7 and 11. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
